name: market for maize grain | maize grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20312/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'maize grain', in the geography of South Africa.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of maize grain, from the production farm to the place it is later used, i.e. maize grain feed production or maize grain processing, dry milling. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'maize grain' is a grain. It is an annual crop. The ecoinvent database also contains this product from organic, Swiss integrated and rainfed production.

The activity starts at the gate of cultivation farm.

The activity ends with the provision of maize grain to the respective process needed.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: South African values: Not applicable worldwide.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data are intended to reflect current equipment and processes in South Africa.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data is primarily sourced from literature and statistics.
